alert.note: Alert for Logan (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued June 15 at 5:07AM MDT until June 17 at 6:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Colorado... South Platte River near Balzac affecting Washington, Logan and Morgan Counties. South Platte River at Atwood affecting Logan County. South Platte River at Fort Morgan affecting Morgan County. South Platte River near Weldona affecting Weld and Morgan Counties. South Platte River near Kersey affecting Weld County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...South Platte River at Atwood. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, The river is out of its banks and into fields and meadows. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:30 AM MDT Thursday the stage was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to crest this morning near 10.0 feet, and then slowly recede through Saturday. - Action stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood stage is 11.5 feet. &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
